questions.question: Which of the following proteins is NOT involved in an apoptotic pathway?
options: c-kit receptor
Caspase 8
Fas receptor
p53 protein

questions.question: Which one of the following is NOT a potential cause of pulmonary hypertension in dogs?
options: Generalised alveolar hypoxia
Left-sided congestive heart failure
Living at high altitude
Treatment with alpha-adrenergic agonists

questions.question: Which statement regarding blood products is CORRECT?
options: During whole blood storage, concentration of 2,3 diphosphoglycerate increases, decreasing hemoglobin's affinity for oxygen
Fresh Frozen Plasma (FFP) is an adequate source of albumin
Stored Frozen Plasma (SFP) and Fresh Frozen Plasma (FFP) both have adequate concentrations of Vitamin K dependent proteins
Stored Frozen Plasma (SFP) and Fresh Frozen Plasma (FFP) have equal amounts of factor V and factor VIII

questions.question: Synthetic colloids can be used for resuscitation fluid therapy. Which statement about the use of synthetic colloids is CORRECT?
options: Acute kidney injury is a frequent complication of synthetic colloids
Synthetic colloids can affect platelet function
The lower the C2:C6 ratio, the longer the persistence of colloids in the blood
When colloids are used in place of crystalloids for treatment of hypotension, approximately half of the crystalloid dose should be given

questions.question: Which statement regarding the interpretation of diagnostic tests is CORRECT?
options: A highly specific test is ideal as a screening test
Accuracy is a measure of a test's reproducibility: an accurate test gives very similar results if repeated testing is performed on any given sample
The sensitivity of a test is the probability that a patient who tests positive actually has the disease
The specificity of a test is the probability that a patient will test negative when it does not have the disease

questions.question: Which statement concerning cardiovascular physiology and auscultation is CORRECT?
options: A loud third heart sound may indicate elevated ventricular diastolic pressures
The fourth heart sound, if heard, occurs during early diastole
The second heart sound correlates with vibrations at the time of closure of the atrioventricular valves
The second heart sound occurs at the end of systole, following the P wave on the electrocardiogram
